ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My ability to read, write, and speak German improved drastically over a short period of time.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Everyone knew some german besides me :(

The strengths are that the course is immersive but also fun, and allows rather quick learning of the language. It featured a good balance of German culture and practice speaking spontaneously with grammar lessons. One thing I felt was sometimes a weakness was the online homework. The CONNECT questions were often helpful and were effective in reinforcing the lessons in the book/from class, but there were also often questions that required listening to a speaker and typing what was said, and these felt like a waste of time because they often included vocabulary that we had not yet learned and the answer was marked wrong unless it was typed exactly as spoken. Similarly, the online forum was a great thing but problems arose due to lack of participation. Finally, I think the class would benefit from more practice speaking and listening to native speakers. Overall though, I highly enjoyed the course and would recommend it to others.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this class to any student interesting in starting German. I really enjoyed it and learned a lot very quickly.
